SVGPathElement.summary: The SVGPathElement interface corresponds to the path element.

blockquote.para: In SVG 2 the getPathSegAtLength() and createSVGPathSeg* methods were removed and the pathLength property and the getTotalLength() and getPointAtLength() methods were moved to .

SVGPathElementGetPathData.summary: NOTE Experimental The SVGPathElement.getPathData() method returns the sequence of path segments that corresponds to the path data, optionally normalizing the values and segment types.
SVGPathElementGetPathData.returns: An array of path segments corresponding to the path data. If no valid path data exists, returns an empty sequence.Each path segment is an object with the following properties:

SVGPathElementGetPathSegmentAtLength.summary: NOTE Experimental The getPathSegmentAtLength() method of the interface returns the path segment at a given distance along the path.
SVGPathElementGetPathSegmentAtLength.returns: A path segment object. If no valid segment exists, returns null.Segment object has the following properties:

SVGPathElementGetPointAtLength.summary: The getPointAtLength() method of the interface returns the point at a given distance along the path.
SVGPathElementGetPointAtLength.returns: A indicating the point at a given distance along the path.

SVGPathElementGetTotalLength.summary: The getTotalLength() method of the interface returns the user agent's computed value for the total length of the path in user units.
SVGPathElementGetTotalLength.returns: A number indicating the total length of the path in user units.

SVGPathElementPathLength.summary: The pathLength read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("pathLength")}} attribute of the given {{SVGelement("path")}} element.

SVGPathElementSetPathData.summary: NOTE Experimental The SVGPathElement.setPathData() method sets the sequence of path segments as the new path data.
